com.pump.image.pixel.quantize

Class ImageQuantization

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.pixel.quantize.ImageQuantization
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ErrorDiffusionImageQuantization, NearestNeighborImageQuantization

    public abstract class ImageQuantization
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an algorithm that converts an image with thousands or millions of colors into a simpler image with a fixed color palette.

    • Field Detail

      • NEAREST_NEIGHBOR

        public static ImageQuantization NEAREST_NEIGHBOR
        This simply identifies the closest approximation of every color. No dithering or diffusion here. The diffusion algorithms will offer much better results.

      • SIMPLEST_DIFFUSION

        public static ImageQuantization SIMPLEST_DIFFUSION
        This uses a 2x2 kernel for error diffusion. Sometimes this is simply referred to as "Two-dimensional error diffusion". The kernel is: 
        [ [ 0, 2],
  [ 1, 1] ]

        The designation as "simplest" is a naming oversimplification: error diffusion is not limited to exactly 3 tiers ("simplest", "medium" and "most"). But for the sake of casual comparison it seemed like a more helpful name.

      • MEDIUM_DIFFUSION

        public static ImageQuantization MEDIUM_DIFFUSION
        This uses a 2x3 kernel (Floyd and Steinberg) for error diffusion. The kernel is: 
        [ [ 0, 0, 7],
  [ 3, 5, 1] ]

        The designation as "medium" is a naming oversimplification: error diffusion is not limited to exactly 3 tiers ("simplest", "medium" and "most"). But for the sake of casual comparison it seemed like a more helpful name.

      • MOST_DIFFUSION

        public static ImageQuantization MOST_DIFFUSION
        This uses a 3x5 kernel (Bell Labs) for error diffusion. The kernel is: 
        [ [ 0, 0, 0, 7, 5],
  [ 3, 5, 7, 5, 3] ]
  [ 1, 3, 5, 3, 1] ]

        The designation as "most" is a naming oversimplification: error diffusion is not limited to exactly 3 tiers ("simplest", "medium" and "most"). But for the sake of casual comparison it seemed like a more helpful name.

        public ImageQuantization()

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage reduce(java.awt.image.BufferedImage src,
                                                  int maxColors)
        Create a copy of an image using a reduced color palette.

        This uses the BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization and MEDIUM_DIFFUSION.

        Parameters:
        src - the image to reduce the palette of.
        maxColors - the maximum number of allowed colors.
        Returns:
        a new reduced image.

      • createImage

        public final java.awt.image.BufferedImage createImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage source,
                                                      ColorLUT colorLUT)
        Create a copy of the image argument using only the colors provided in the color look-up table argument.
        Parameters:
        source - the image to downsample.
        colorLUT - the new color table to use. This must be created from an IndexColorModel.

      • createImageData

        public abstract IndexedBytePixelIterator createImageData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage source,
                                                         ColorLUT colorLUT)
        Create a copy of the image argument using only the colors provided in the color look-up table argument.
        Parameters:
        source - the image to downsample.
        colorLUT - the new color table to use. This must be created from an IndexColorModel.
